image.altText: Triple zero number about to be called on a mobile phone.

props.synopsis: Victoria's triple-0 dispatch software fails due to a power outage, forcing operators to take notes with pen and paper.

title.children: Software failure during power outage affects Victoria's triple-0 response

image.altText: Three poker machines in a club with brightly coloured screens showing different gambling games, with three empty stools in front

props.synopsis: Victorian councils taking part in a trial of account-based play at pokies venues say they're disappointed with the state government's handling of the scheme.

title.children: Victorian government slammed for 'sham trial' of gambling cards

image.altText: CFA members holding signs outside parliament

props.synopsis: Despite resentment and anger from some farmers, the CFA says it's well prepared to deal with an elevated fire risk this spring and summer.

title.children: Victorian volunteer firefighter numbers grow despite levy angst

image.altText: Child's hand on play equipment

props.synopsis: The chief executive and chief operating officer at one of Australia's biggest childcare chains have resigned following a string of scandals, including dozens of sex abuse charges being laid against a former employee.

title.children: Top executives at Affinity Education Group resign after childcare scandals

image.altText: A photo of Aidan McLindon.

props.synopsis: Municipal monitors will be reappointed to an embattled council in Melbourne's booming outer north following an inquiry probing the lead-up to the suspension of a former mayor.

title.children: 'Wrecking ball' former mayor to return to Melbourne council

image.altText: A man wearing a black singlet walking through a media pack

props.synopsis: The brother of a man accused of negligent manslaughter has told a Victorian court that he knew how violent his brother could be.

title.children: Accused's brother recounts last time he saw Emma Bates alive

image.altText: Jacinta Allan in a blue blazer standing next to Rueben Berg on the steps of parliament.

props.synopsis: The Victorian Liberals will scrap the state's proposed Treaty agreement with First Peoples' if elected. The opposition had previously withdrawn support for the proposed agreement, which is set to be debated in Parliament today and is expected to pass with the support of Labor and the Greens.

title.children: Victorian Liberals will scrap Australian-first Treaty within 100 days if elected

image.altText: A portable electronic sign saying "Mt Buffalo National Park Closed" sits beside a road with white blossom trees behind.

props.synopsis: Victoria Police says its search for alleged gunman Dezi Freeman will continue as the Mount Buffalo National Park partially reopens.

title.children: National Park to partially reopen despite Dezi Freeman search

image.altText: Two police officers stand behind police tape that blocks a CBD street.

props.synopsis: Police say the gun a man pointed at people in Melbourne on Tuesday was a fake firearm. They have charged him with multiple offences following an alleged carjacking spree through the city.

title.children: Man charged after alleged carjackings, dramatic pursuit in Melbourne CBD

image.altText: Tarni White of the Magpies reacts during the AFLW Round six match.

props.synopsis: Collingwood's Tarni White says it feels as though the women's competition is being used as a trial run for new rules before they are implemented into the men's league.

title.children: Frustration mounts over AFLW being used as a 'trial run' for new rules

image.altText: A grey-haired man in a dark blazer stands outdoors.

props.synopsis: The Police Association welcomes the Victorian chief commissioner's new strategy to get more officers on the streets, but says tougher sentences the only effective solution to crime crisis.

title.children: Police union calls for tougher sentences amid soaring crime in Victoria

image.altText: A person in black running up a driveway

props.synopsis: A rise in car theft and carjackings in this state has also seen parents left terrorised as cars are taken with their children inside.

title.children: One car every 44 minutes: Welcome to Australia's car-theft capital

image.altText: A blonde woman with light pink lipstick, earrings, long eyelashes wearing a white top

props.synopsis: Police have called in dogs capable of tracking electronic devices as they resume their search for Lucinda Miller, who disappeared three years ago after travelling to eastern Victoria.

title.children: Police resume search for young woman three years after disappearance

image.altText: Dave Hughes in a video posted to social media platform, Instagram, lying in a hospital bed

props.synopsis: Comedian Dave Hughes has returned to hospital, six weeks after suffering five broken ribs and a punctured lung in the AFL's Legends game.

title.children: Dave Hughes in hospital again six weeks after AFL Legends game

image.altText: A child plays Roblox on a computer in their bedroom.

props.synopsis: Experts warn Roblox has a predator problem, amid reports Australian children are being exposed to a range of disturbing experiences on the platform.

title.children: How sexual predators and far-right extremists are using Roblox to target children

image.altText: Smoke billows from a small, badly damaged building with metal cladding at night.

props.synopsis: A man is charged with setting two community sports clubhouses on fire in Melbourne's south-east this year.

title.children: Man charged after sports clubs burn down, causing $4m in damage

image.altText: A school boy wearing a uniform

props.synopsis: The family of Thom Hosking are remembering him as a "smart and dedicated student" full of potential.

title.children: 15-year-old remembered as 'glue' of family after being hit by truck near school

image.altText: A middle-aged man wearing navy blue police uniform looks on sideways

props.synopsis: Victoria Police will slim down its executive team and divert more officers to the front line under reforms aimed at reducing crime in the state.

title.children: Victoria Police to slim down executive, divert more officers to front line

image.altText: Zach Merrett looks to his left after the Bombers lost to the Swans.

props.synopsis: The big three of Zach Merrett, Charlie Curnow and Christian Petracca remain in limbo with one day left in the trade period, with Brayden Fiorini going from Gold Coast to Essendon the main move of the day.

title.children: Bombers position ‘unchanged’ on Merrett after Hawks' offer, as Swans chase Curnow

image.altText: A couple aged in their 30s or 40s walks through a regional street wearing caps partly obscuring their faces.

props.synopsis: Lawyers for a couple accused of vandalising significant artefacts say the damage caused by sprinkling vegetable oil was unintentional and part of a "blessing".

title.children: Alleged Bendigo museum vandals maintain damage was 'religious act'

image.altText: A man wearing a black singlet walking through a media pack

props.synopsis: John Torney's committal hearing begins as his mother tells the court she was the one who called police to check on the woman before her body was found.

title.children: Accused's mother gives evidence in Emma Bates's manslaughter case

image.altText: The facade of an old theatre

props.synopsis: In the Yarriambiack Shire, 350 kilometres from Melbourne in Victoria's rural north-west, virtually all of the towns are shrinking.

title.children: In one of Australia's fastest-shrinking regions, towns are fighting to remain

image.altText: The GrainCorp factory in Numurkah emitting smoke.

props.synopsis: The class action was brought by a northern Victorian man who alleged that noise and odour pollution from a GrainCorp factory affected his health.

title.children: GrainCorp settles class action over noise and pollution

image.altText: A man with short grey hair in a white collared shirt and grey jeans stands with his hands in his pockets beside a picket fence.

props.synopsis: Police have charged two boys, aged 14 and 15, over two alleged early morning break-ins in Melbourne — one of which allegedly saw a man chase and restrain a teenager.

title.children: Teens charged after home owner detains alleged 15-year-old intruder

image.altText: Aboriginal man wearing a blue sequined top with dyed blue hair with skyscrapers in the background

props.synopsis: An Indigenous elder well-known for his sporting achievements, including using long-distance running and cycling to advocate for Aboriginal reconciliation and health issues, is remembered by loved ones.

title.children: Doctor's dire warning sent endurance athlete on life mission

image.altText: Three grey and white haired men dressed in grey suits with many medals on their lapels, smile near trees.

props.synopsis: Former Victoria Police officer Michael Pratt has been remembered for his bravery when he confronted three armed bank robbers in Melbourne in 1978.

title.children: 'Australia lost a true hero': George Cross recipient Michael Pratt dies

image.altText: A woman with long red hair stands in profile, a stern-looking woman stands behind her, facing forward

props.synopsis: First dismissed as "Gothic romance" when it was published by Daphne du Maurier in 1938, the haunting tale has evolved into a modern thriller about the expectations placed on women.

title.children: Rebecca was a novel, a Hitchcock classic, and now a thriller on stage

image.altText: Essendon captain Zach Merrett stands in the race looking up as he waits to leads his team out at Carrara.

props.synopsis: Zach Merrett is one of a number of former All-Australians currently in limbo as West Coast continues to wheel and deal after another wooden spoon and Port Adelaide secures a midfielder.

title.children: Merrett deadlock continues as major AFL trades now racing the clock

image.altText: Jamie-Lee Price and Tarle Mathe challenge for the ball in the Diamonds vs Proteas netball Test.

props.synopsis: Despite the comfortable series win over South Africa, Australia is mindful it will need to step up a gear in the Constellation Cup against New Zealand.

title.children: Diamonds mindful they need to lift against Silver Ferns

image.altText: Reporter holds a freshly shucked oyster with a crate of unopened oysters in the background.

props.synopsis: Victoria could have its own Sydney rock oyster industry after a trial in the state's east yielded positive results.

title.children: Victorians could soon enjoy homegrown Sydney rock oysters

image.altText: Police vehicles parked outside a restaurant with a neon sign saying "Marmont".

props.synopsis: The men were allegedly attacked on the Yarra Promenade overnight. Police arrested five teenagers and have charged three of them.

title.children: Teens charged after father and son allegedly stabbed in Melbourne

image.altText: Jack Raynor crosses the finish line.

props.synopsis: Melbourne's Jack Rayner won the men's marathon for the second year in a row with a time of 2 hours, 15 minutes and 2 seconds.

title.children: Record-breaking Melbourne Marathon Festival as 50,000 runners hit the road

image.altText: Troy Milne

props.synopsis: Police are appealing to the public for help in locating a man who left to pick up supplies while camping with his wife in Gippsland.

title.children: Man goes missing after picking up supplies camping in Gippsland

image.altText: Pro-Palestinian protesters gather in Sydney's Hyde Park with flags and signs

props.synopsis: The rallies in cities and towns dubbed the Nationwide Rally for Palestine come less than a week after the second anniversary of the October 7 terrorist attack.

title.children: Thousands join pro-Palestinian rallies in towns and cities amid ceasefire

image.altText: A man in a white and gold striped top holds a teddy while sitting on a couch beside a woman holding a framed photo of a baby.

props.synopsis: The death of a 15-week-old baby in an unlicensed home daycare in Victoria’s north-west is among more than two dozen disturbing childcare incidents recorded in government documents unearthed by the ABC.

title.children: Fears baby's death in illegal childcare centre is 'tip of the iceberg'
